task.title: Task: Main and subform
task.shortdesc: Creation of a main form and subform with the Form Wizard.

context.p: The easiest way to make a main form having a subform is with the aid of the Form Wizard. This wizard makes the two forms and provides the linking.
The goal is to create a form that displays customer code, name and address, and further shows the corresponding orders with order code, order date and order subtotal.

The customer data is going to the main form and all necessary fields are available in table Customers. The subform will display the order data: OrderCode, OrderDate and a calculated subtotal. The subtotal can be calculated from the fields Quantity and BoxPrice (table Boxes).

To display the subtotal on a form, you need a query which can offer all these data as a source to the subform. Such a query is already available and is named Orders with subtotals. This query contains also the field CustomerCode, so that a link between the main and subform can be established.

step.cmd: Choose tab Create Form Wizard (group Forms) .
Select in box Tables/Queries Table: Customers.
Add successively the following fields: CustomerCode, FirstName, LastName, Address, ZipCode, City, Telephone.
Select in box Tables/Queries Query: Orders with subtotals.
step.stepresult: The fields of the query are displayed in the box Available Fields.

step.cmd: Add successively the following fields: OrderCode, OrderDate and Subtotal. Click Next.
Check the settings and then click Next.

stepresult.p: The wizard now asks for the layout of the subform: Tabular or Datasheet.

step.cmd: Select layout Datasheet and click Next.

stepresult.p: You can now enter titles for the form and subform. There are already default titles available, but you can change these titles.

step.cmd: Change the default titles as follows. Form title = Customers and Orders and Subform title = Customers and Orders Subform.

stepresult.note: If desired, both the design of the main form and the subform can be modified.
